posts.post_content: Unless you are playing a serious arcane deck, this is a fairly weak card. It's a lot to pay for a situational effect, and discard is at its best early game. Even if you want to play an arcane deck, why are you in black? Green ([Hana Kami](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hana Kami)) and red ([Ire of Kaminari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ire of Kaminari)) offer more incentive, as does blue.
posts.html:
Unless you are playing a serious arcane deck, this is a fairly weak card. It's a lot to pay for a situational effect, and discard is at its best early game. Even if you want to play an arcane deck, why are you in black? Green (Hana Kami) and red (Ire of Kaminari) offer more incentive, as does blue.

posts.post_content:
[Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot) costs {2}{B}, which is 3 CMC for 2 cards, this adds 1 more discard for {1}{B}, so it is more on average for the last card; however the fact that it is all one card is worth it. 2 Mind Rot's would be {4}{B}{B}, which is 1 more mana for an extra card. again, you have now used 2 of your cards and you lose card advantage. In other words, this card ain't half bad. 3/5  
  
EDIT::  
Just ordered 1000 random cards online from a nameless source,Frog and Ogre or something like that. Anyway, they must have read my post because they sent me 41 of these. DOH!

posts.post_content: It IS overcosted. [Mindstab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindstab) thrull was the original. Every \*good\* discard card discards at a 1-to-1 except Mind Twist. Every other discard, including some that work at 1-to-1 are considered mediocre at best.
posts.html:
It IS overcosted. Mindstab thrull was the original. Every *good* discard card discards at a 1-to-1 except Mind Twist. Every other discard, including some that work at 1-to-1 are considered mediocre at best.

Posted By: Paolino (1/13/2012 1:11:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is NOT overcosted. Compare [Fugue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fugue), [Mindstab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindstab), and [Hypnotic Cloud](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hypnotic Cloud).  
  
The issue is really that discard effects at-cost become undesirable above "discard two." In a dedicated discard deck, your opponent probably won't have three cards in hand by the time you can cast this, and in any other type of deck, you're more likely to use smaller discard that you can control (like [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress)) rather than going for sheer number of cards to discard.
posts.html:
This card is NOT overcosted. Compare Fugue, Mindstab, and Hypnotic Cloud.

The issue is really that discard effects at-cost become undesirable above "discard two." In a dedicated discard deck, your opponent probably won't have three cards in hand by the time you can cast this, and in any other type of deck, you're more likely to use smaller discard that you can control (like Duress) rather than going for sheer number of cards to discard.
